bow: why wo my daughter sleep she does not sleep she does sleep in the day and she does sleep at night get hours total sleep from her if lucky she month old and twin her brother is fine and our eldest son slept fine it not as if she just wakes to feed and then back to sleep she fully alert and screaming and wants to be into everything she wo go down ever and has to be fed to sleep or fall asleep in the car arms however she will sleep on me the only way can settle her is bringing her into our bed but really do want to make habit out of it she already being treated for reflux and the fact she sleeps happily in my bed suggests to me that it not the position that the issue she literally screams like nazgul and wakes her brothers if left for longer than 60 seconds too advice please quite perplexed with this sadly have no advice as still pregnant with my first but appreciate the nazgul reference it certainly gives perspective to the matter lol thank you ve never heard sound like it from human child before she tiny as well so if we were utterly sleep deprived it would be hilarious to hear such noise coming from someone so small and sweet looking wish had advice but just wanted to commiserate having twins in september and if our little girl is anything like was according to my mom then going to be in the exact same boat our daughter had reflux as well but slept fine in her bassinet in our room transferring her to her crib caused really pissed off kid we found that white noise machine and black out curtain made all the difference recreating our bedroom with sound smells etc really seemed to help facebook group respectful sleep training hard to post on ther lots of rules to post anything but if you follow the rules they are great also the files saved topics are really helpful personally recom total extinction cry it out but its up to you if you can do it this sounds little crazy but have you ruled out external factors for example dd2 is terrified of the dark until we figured that our she was little hellbeast at bedtime would say make list of every tiny detail you can think of about your bedroom and the same list for your daughter room see which small things are different and try and rule them out one by one babies can be so sensitive and something that seems so small to us may have big impact on baby also sometimes we just do see obvious differences such as another commenter saying her baby was afraid of the dark maybe nightlight would benefit you might consider joining the group with november babies and asking there about 1200 moms with and month olds info https imgur com co6bddl not the op but thank you for mentioning this resource np found it very helpful seconding this group their files section was game changer for us in terms of sleep we also had great experience with extinction caused our daughter so much less stress than the no cry methods we had tried previously we had sleep problems about the same age and finally caved and did cry it out know it not for everyone but we regret not doing it sooner she now and sleeps like champ still is there somewhere that brother can sleep for week or two so she can cry without disturbing him can you try sleep sack or swaddle like thing my daughter is the same swaddling helps us some what tend to get hrs of uninterrupted sleep at time does she sleep on her back or stomach removed my brothers and all struggled with real milk when we were children baby age as soon as my mother tried non dairy alternative we were okay slept through the night none of us are lactose intolerant now it might not be the case here but it could be at least worth shot for one night regarding her sleeping with you it may might just be comforting when she uncomfortable good luck do we have the same baby mine is almost months but this is her she takes maybe 20 minute naps during the day she finally sleeps at or and is then up at 11 and then every hour to two hours afterward if in her crib does better in my bed which happens bc get so tired she been horrible sleeper since birth she is wide awake for every single newborn photo any chance of medical issues both of mine were like this at first one had silent reflux the other had obstructive sleep apnea neither liked sleeping unless they were touching me preferably with me sitting up or standing my son is 11 months old and ve had sleep troubles off and on with him since he was months old if your daughter doesn have stomach related issues it could be due to teething also when my son has really bad days where his mouth is bothering him make sure to give him tylenol or ibuprofen sometime before bed as for refusing to go down he grew out of his bassinet and the transition to crib was not an easy one he was around months old when first started trying in the crib started with nap time and once he got used to going down for naps then tried at night also got really good about following his tired cues rubbing his eyes yawning and not putting him down too soon or too late amp try to keep his same routine daily at around months old when he seemed like he just wouldn go down for anything think lot due to the startle reflex got him weighted sleep sack which he loved once he got old enough to roll onto his stomach which he initially preferred switched to regular sleep sack he will not sleep without this at night sometimes he will for nap but majority of the time he in it think it not only keeps him warm but provides that sense of security without me worrying about blanket in the crib **additionally when they get older the sack prevents them from climbing out of the crib** now aside from the sleep sack he won sleep in the crib unless his crib insert is in there it supposed to be like knock off dock tot but it on amazon and the brand is abreeze it was 65 00 and worth every penny if you re able to spend that would give it go if you have been trying to put her down without noisemaker buy cheap one that has white noise and use that and fan then keep the room around 71 degrees sound crazy know but use all of these things combined for my son and that how got him comfortable with going down in his crib it like his own little sanctuary it might seem like bit much but from one tired mama to another it what worked for me sorry for the lengthy post hope it helped some my son had bad reflux it was awful got to the point where could lay him in his bassinet but had incline thing that fit in it that helped keep his body at an angle little to help that and infant probiotics did the trick with us though know every baby is different maybe consider taking her to chiropractor know it sounds crazy but you can look into it online many medical issues can be helped this way best of luck second this thought my daughter was terrible sleeper treating for reflux helped little but it was until we diagnosed and treated her asthma and allergies that it improved significantly because she was finally able to be comfortable and get some restful sleep know this probably is popular answer but it really worked for us we did crying it out it was not easy by any means but it was very worth it my daughter had to learn that we will come back but that she needed to soothe herself our doctor said at certain weight and age she was ready for it so if you re considering it confirm with your doctor truly crying it out is as awful as many people think and there is structured way to do it so your child is just left crying all night do however totally sympathize with you hope you get some sleep with whichever method you choose my reflux baby has asthma well rad currently since we have seen the pulmonologist yet and he only 18 months and allergies as well know reflux increases their risk of developing asthma but now curious how much it increases it my son had an egg allergy once we figured that out he went from waking up 5x night at yr old to only waking up once night he now and still not great sleeper but getting the eggs of his diet really made the biggest difference no advice but wanted to offer solidarity months was the worst time for me my daughter simply would not sleep spent multiple nights with less than hours before going to work more than once could be found curled up under my desk over lunch just when thought could take it one more day she suddenly got past it and everything got better this will pass eventually have month old twins too sleep train started when they were 14 weeks and they ve been sleeping through the night since and they mostly sleep through each other cries too learn to safely cosleep mama huge population of mothers have to do this in order to get some sleep when you re holding her wrap her in dirty shirt of yours maybe if she smells you in her sleep she wont wake up my son just turned was the same way deep pressure still calms him down he asks for squeezes when he struggling to calm himself at months we were still swaddling him with his arms out because it was the only way he could fall asleep why are these set to private kinda still learning reddit like to join one of these for my baby removed my daughter is now but we went through months of what called hell she just stopped sleeping would scream and cry if was holding her tried cry it out but she just would go for hours gave in and just let her sleep with me then slowly worked her back to her bed using pack play in my room by 11 months she was back in her own bed and fine have the slightest idea what caused it my son never had the issue no help really sorry about that good luck just know it will end soon then you will oddly miss it lt ours did this too until we used gentle not cry it out sleep training method on her at 11 mos she been sleeping 11 12 hours straight ever since but feel you omg thought was going to make it when she was tiny really did people get pretty familiar and personal in their monthly bumper subs so they typically go private when the group is few months pregnant it keeps the creeps at bay and gives sense of community normally you can just message mod and request to join this is such an accurate description how do you find the right mod though maybe it just phone thing but my only option is to press continue and it backs me out man that really sucks my baby 6mo and had no idea this was thing open and login to reddit in desktop browser and go to messages envelope icon send the message to bumpergroupname and it will go to the mods send private message to the community by logging into reddit on desktop browser rather than addressing it to person address your message to the sub ex february2019bumpers mine are october babies but were supposed to be january babies 13 weeks premature which one is best to join did know we had these she is already on neocate should ve mentioned that forgot because allergic to dairy and all of my kids are too so it the norm in our house she months corrected so possibly yeah my daughter has never slept well even as tiny baby never did apparently the boys take after my husband and sleep like log possibly she was premature and has weak chest milk allergy and eczema both of which know can be linked to other allergies might ask them to switch her reflux meds as they changed her to omeprazole from ranitidine and she seemed bit more settled previously good luck the first months are the hardest removed either she moves what this is my baby get snarky comments about her not going to bed til 11 but try so hard to get her to bed before then but she having none of it every night she ends up in with me which not fan of see that others have mentioned white noise and swaddling and would like to throw in my two cents that those worked wonders for both of my kids mine are now and and still need white noise as do it great too because when they re older and sleep through the night white noise blocks out sounds like tv and music so you aren tiptoeing around after bedtime as for swaddling my daughter never liked her arms held but swaddled her from the chest down and something about that bit of pressure calmed her down ve let both of my kids cry it out from time to time as well because sometimes know they re tired so ll give them about minutes or so and they usually fall asleep in that time in the end when all else fails just let them sleep in my bed know it not for lot of people but just remember that it won last forever and enjoy the snuggles while can my baby girl is likely my last and still crawls in bed with me most nights during the day she busy little bee who barely has time for cuddle hope you can find something that works for you and her co slept with both of my non sleeping jerk babies it was literally all could do you re not alone in being tortured by these little devils what kind of method did you use my son has reflux issues and we had really hard time trying to get him to sleep and us for the first several months of his life he would need to be rocked held to fall asleep and also needed to be in an upright position he slept terribly until we started sleep training 20 minute naps several times day thinking you all could benefit from your kiddo learning independent sleep someone in the comments recommends cosleeping but would recommend it as its just creating more problems babies who cosleep have more difficult time figuring out how to sleep on their own and its more difficult for you too sleep training all the way baby lol hear you joined or so months ago and even now still sometimes reviewing the files to get refresher to make sure still doing everything properly haha we did the timed intervals think it worked the best he finally understood that we were always going to be there and now he sleeps pretty well put him down he smiles rolls over and does his wiggle worm dance move and passes out it awesome lol it sad how bad rep sleep training has especially with cio her daughter seems to do well when she sleeping next to mom her babe needs to learn some sleep independence for things to get better she stops crying once held so you know nothing is really wrong you can join two if you want our sub has some moms whose babies were premature happened to find out from babybumps ohh thanks my sons have friend and his mother told me he sleeps or less hours and always has been terrible sleeper the doctors said there is nothing wrong he functions perfectly fine some just do need as much sleep thank you don have much advice for sleeping other than maybe putting her next to your bed in cosleeper not much for supporting the cry it out method maybe even consider letting her in your bed you re where she feels safest as mom of two preemies can definitely relate to what you re going through they may be or months old but they re technically only or months old as far as some development goes agreed every child is different and sometimes different methods work for one but not the other get sad when mom bashing happens when someone is just looking for any option to try yup my sleep is it can help with reflux though and just because she sleeps with mom doesn mean there not something else wrong it could be that moms comfort helps her get past whatever is wrong
